channel.title: Cache Valley Communities
channel.description: Recent content on Cache Valley Communities

item.title: Tree Planting Volunteer Opportunity with Northwestern Band of the Shoshone Nation
item.description: Join the Northwestern Band of the Shoshone Nation on November 7th and 8th for a tree-planting weekend at the Bear River Massacre site in Idaho. Help restore the land with native plants and support long-term ecological recovery.

item.title: Tree Planting Volunteer Opportunity with Northwestern Band of the Shoshone Nation
item.description: Join the Northwestern Band of the Shoshone Nation on November 7th and 8th for a tree-planting weekend at the Bear River Massacre site in Idaho. Help restore the land with native plants and support long-term ecological recovery.

item.title: IT STEM Summer Camp (9th Grade Students) - June 2025
item.description: Calling all incoming 9th grade students interested in information technology! The IT STEM summer camp will be June 10th - June 20th, 2025 (Tuesday - Friday), 8:00 AM – 12:00 PM (MST) at Bridgerland Technical College Build, code, and explore with hands-on Raspberry Pi projects, computer teardown, cyber security, and programming. Get ready to jumpstart your future in tech!

item.title: IT STEM Summer Camp (9th Grade Students) - June 2025

Get ready to jumpstart your future in tech!

item.title: Cache Tech Community Meetup - Feburuary 2025
item.description: Join us on Feb 22, 2025, at 1:30 PM (MST) at Bridgerland Technical College for a tech meetup focused on programming and networking. The event features an open discussion on tech careers and a hands-on session where attendees will build a chat application in Go. Open to all skill levels—bring your laptop and curiosity!

item.title: Cache Tech Community Meetup - January 2025
item.description: Join us on Jan 25, 2025, at 1:30 PM (MST) at Logan Library for a tech meetup! The event features an open discussion on tech careers and a deep dive into mobile forensics, including an iPhone forensic demo. Open to all skill levels—come learn and connect!

item.title: Why You Should Join Our Official Discord Server
item.description: Join our official Discord server to stay updated, connect with like-minded individuals, ask questions, showcase your projects, and collaborate with the community. Gain access to exclusive events, discussions, and networking opportunities. Be part of a dynamic and supportive space—join today!

item.title: Why You Should Join Our Official Discord Server

Gain access to exclusive events, discussions, and networking opportunities. Be part of a dynamic and supportive space—join today!

item.title: How to Spot and Avoid Scams
item.description: Scams use urgency, emotional manipulation, and too-good-to-be-true offers to deceive victims. Avoid falling for them by verifying sources, being cautious with unsolicited messages, and protecting personal information. Watch for red flags like suspicious payment methods and unprofessional communication. Stay vigilant, trust your instincts, and report any suspicious activity.

item.title: How to Spot and Avoid Scams
item.description: Scams use urgency, emotional manipulation, and too-good-to-be-true offers to deceive victims. Avoid falling for them by verifying sources, being cautious with unsolicited messages, and protecting personal information. Watch for red flags like suspicious payment methods and unprofessional communication. Stay vigilant, trust your instincts, and report any suspicious activity.

item.title: Cache Tech Community OSINT Workshop - October 2025
item.description: Join us on Friday, October 25th, 2025, from 1:30 PM to 3:30 PM at Bridgerland Technical College for our Cache Tech Community OSINT workshop! This follow-up presentation focuses on protecting yourself from OSINT techniques and minimizing your digital footprint. Whether you’re concerned about privacy, security, or just want to understand how to control your digital presence, this presentation will provide practical, actionable steps to enhance your digital privacy.

item.title: Cache Tech Community OSINT Workshop - October 2025

item.title: DIY Mobile Verification Toolkit (MVT) Workshop
item.description: A self-paced, hands-on workshop on using the Mobile Verification Toolkit (MVT) for ethical mobile forensics. Complete it anytime. Occasional in-person sessions may be offered separately.

item.title: DIY Mobile Verification Toolkit (MVT) Workshop
item.description: A self-paced, hands-on workshop on using the Mobile Verification Toolkit (MVT) for ethical mobile forensics. Complete it anytime. Occasional in-person sessions may be offered separately.

item.title: Cache Tech Community OSINT Workshop - September 2025
item.description: Join us on Saturday, September 27th, 2025, from 1:30 PM to 3:30 PM at Bridgerland Technical College for our Cache Tech Community OSINT workshop! This hands-on workshop will teach you OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) techniques that you can use in investigations, journalism, and cybersecurity. Whether you’re a developer, student, or tech enthusiast, this event is perfect for anyone interested in learning information gathering skills and networking within Cache Valley’s tech scene.

item.title: Cache Tech Community OSINT Workshop - September 2025

Whether you’re a developer, student, or tech enthusiast, this event is perfect for anyone interested in learning information gathering skills and networking within Cache Valley’s tech scene.

item.title: Cache Tech Community Meetup - August 2025
item.description: Join us on August 23rd, 2025 for a special Cache Tech Community meetup featuring CodeCamp: Bridgerland winners presenting their incredible projects! Come celebrate their achievements and connect with Cache Valley’s amazing tech community. Open to everyone—whether you participated in CodeCamp or just want to see some awesome projects!

item.description: Join us on April 26, 2025, at 1:30 PM (MST) at Bridgerland Technical College for a tech meetup focused on self-hosting and privacy. The event features an open discussion on tech careers and a hands-on demo where attendees will learn to self-host applications using Coolify. Open to all skill levels—bring your laptop and curiosity!

item.title: Cache Valley Communities
item.description: A volunteer-led effort helping neighbors in Cache Valley connect, learn, and collaborate through meetups, workshops, and shared resources—linking people with the local groups that already exist.

item.title: DC435 - Cyber Security
item.description: DC435 is a free, community-driven DEFCON group in Cache Valley, UT, focused on InfoSec. Meetings are first Thursdays at 7 PM at Bridgerland Technical College, Logan, UT. Open to all, DC435 fosters learning, collaboration, and respect, with a strict no-harassment policy. Just show up to join!

item.title: W.A.B. Warming Center
item.description: The W.A.B. Warming Center provides a safe, warm space for unhoused individuals and families in Cache Valley, Utah, during the coldest months. It offers resources, supervision, and support to ensure no one is left unsheltered and alone in winter. Families with children are welcome, with safety agreements in place. Visit their official website to learn more.

item.title: Contributors
item.description:
OUR TEAM

Meet the talented individuals who have contributed to the development and growth of this website and its resources. These contributors have played a significant role in making this project a success.

Brent Dalling

Website

Primary contributor to the website, responsible for overseeing the project's direction, design, and development. You can find more about him on his personal website and see his GitHub contributions here.
